t: Send*pn lambs as tribute to*ld the ruler of the land, from*ln Sela, across the desert, to*ld the mount of Daughter Zion.
Like*ln fluttering birds pushed*ld from the nest, so*ln are the women of Moab at*ld the fords of the Arnon.
“Make*pn up your mind,” Moab says. “Render*ld a decision. Make*ln your shadow like night— at*ld high noon. Hide*ln the fugitives, do*ld not betray the refugees.
Let*ln the Moabite fugitives stay with you; be*ld their shelter from the destroyer.” The*pn oppressor will come to an end, and*ld destruction will cease; the*ld aggressor will vanish from the land.
In*ln love a throne will be established; in*ld faithfulness a man will sit on it— one*ld from the house of David— one*ln who in judging seeks justice and*ld speeds the cause of righteousness.
We*pn have heard of Moab’s pride— how*ld great is her arrogance!— of*ln her conceit, her pride and her insolence; but*ld her boasts are empty.
Therefore*ln the Moabites wail, they*ld wail together for Moab. Lament*ln and grieve for*ld the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth.

The*ln fields of Heshbon wither, the*ld vines of Sibmah also. The*ln rulers of the nations have*ld trampled down the choicest vines, which*ln once reached Jazer and*ld spread toward the desert. Their*ln shoots spread out and*ld went as far as the sea.
So*ln I weep, as Jazer weeps, for*ld the vines of Sibmah. Heshbon*ln and Elealeh, I*ld drench you with tears! The*ln shouts of joy over your ripened fruit and*ld over your harvests have been stilled.
Joy*ln and gladness are taken away from the orchards; no*ld one sings or shouts in the vineyards; no*ln one treads out wine at the presses, for*ld I have put an end to the shouting.
My*ln heart laments for Moab like a harp, my*ld inmost being for Kir Hareseth.
When*ln Moab appears at her high place, she*ld only wears herself out; when*ln she goes to her shrine to pray, it*ld is to no avail.
This*p is the word the Lord*s has already spoken concerning Moab.

But now the Lord*s says: “Within three years, as a servant bound by contract would count them, Moab’s splendor and all her many people will be despised, and her survivors will be very few and feeble.”
